info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 15 at 11:57AM AKDT until September 16 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS Juneau AK
info.description:
Very heavy rain is occurring over the Ketchikan area due to an Atmospheric River. The rain is expected to continue through the daylight hours Monday, then shift off to the NW Monday night.
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Near Ketchikan.
* WHEN...Until 100 AM AKDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. Ponding of water in areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1130 AM AKDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in Ketchikan. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 2.25 inches of rain have fallen between 3am and 11am Monday. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.25 to 2.25 inches are possible through the Monday evening.
info.instruction:
Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
Persons in steep terrain should be alert for the possibility of localized landslides.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKDT TUESDAY
